required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anal Incontinence After Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence and Risk Factors for Anal Incontinence After Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury

brief_summary.textblock:
Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury is an identified risk factor for anal incontinence. The mechanisms and the risk factors for anal incontinence in Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury women are not well known.
Anal incontinence in such women is not well documented and probably underestimated. Cohort studies estimated that up to 53% of Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury women are incontinent but that most of them does not complain their doctor.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from the childbirth to the day of survey (2 to 16 years after childbirth)
primary_outcome.description: loss of stool or gas ≥1/week during ≥1 month

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Incidence of anal incontinence the date of the survey (2 to 16 years after childbirth)
secondary_outcome.description: AI graded by the St Mark Score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the childbirth to the date of the survey (2 to 16 years after childbirth)
secondary_outcome.description: all the resolutive episodes of occurence of anal incontinence are reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life with fecal incontinence quality of life score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the date of the survey (2 to 16 years after childbirth)
secondary_outcome.description: fecal incontinence quality of life score

secondary_outcome.measure: Expectation of the women in term of information
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the date of the survey (2 to 16 years after childbirth)
secondary_outcome.description: 2 questions on the expectation of the women in term of information towards the Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury

intervention.description: collection of data for all Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury women (score of quality of life, experimenting anal incontinence...)

study_pop.textblock: All women that gave birth between 2005 January 1st and 2019 December 31th and that accept to respond to the survey

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Childbirth between 2005 January 1st and 2019 December 31th
- Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury -≥ 18 y
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients' refusal
- lost of view or deceased
- anal incontinence before the Obstetrical Anal Sphincter Injury
